result.execSummary:
The defendant Reece A. Perrigo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reece A. Perrigo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Reece A. Perrigo was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber Granted
Report clean & sober.  May be transferred to either Brown, Marinette, Outagamie or Oconto Counties.

to Court from defendant
MARQUETTE COUNTY DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION

Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states plea agreement.  Atty Hendee agrees and moves to amend Ct. 1 to Poss. of THC,  Misd. 961.41(3g)(e) Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Gumz makes a statement to the court.
Defendant makes a statemen to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1, Poss. of THC,  Misd. 961.41(3g)(e) :  Court orders 6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before June 10, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May transfer to Brown County, Marinette County, Outagamie County or Oconto County
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
Plea hearing on May 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Final pre-trial on August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that there has been discussions on resolution however, the defendant has questions.  Atty Gumz states that the DA gave 7 days to accept the offer; if not it will be withdrawn.
Atty Hendee agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Return date at 03-16-2016 02:30 pm

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states his client is employed in the Green Bay area.  Still needs the specifics of the agreement with the DA.  Requests another return date.  No objection by Atty Hendee.
BY THE COURT:  Reset.  Return date scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Return date at 01-20-2016 01:45 pm

State files Information.  Atty Gumz received the Information and waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Bond continued.

Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives his right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant and finds the waiver to be made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.  Return date scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 12-02-2015 10:15 am

Defendant Reece A. Perrigo in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests preliminary hearing be set.  Atty Gumz agrees.  BY THE COURT:  Set preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Return date at 10-21-2015 01:30 pm
Return date at 09-16-2015 03:30 pm
